result.execSummary:
The defendant Ernest Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 1 day only if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 5 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.
The defendant must submit a DNA sample.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Huber allowed - eligible for community service - no objections to the defendant serving this time in Milwaukee County Jail or any other State of WI County Jail but it is the ultimate decision of the Sheriff(s).

records.addlTxt: from def: requesting good time - court denies as confinemant is a condition of probation and is not eligible for "good time" reduction. Clerk mails copy back to defendant.
Per phone call to DA, an Amended Information is not needed.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ernest Evans in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 8:38 AM. State - resolved - defendant would plead G to count #2 as alleged and counts #1, #3 and #4 (after Clerk receives Amended Information that includes that count) will be DRI, joint recommendation of 3 years probation and defense is free to argue for conditional time, State is recommending 1 year conditional time and conditions of probation are subject to argument. Chernin and Evans agree. Court dismisses and reads in counts #1 and #3 and #4 if State files the Amended Information. Chernin pleads G to count #2 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freel, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends 1 year of conditional jail with other conditions of: AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars, employment/school, 200 hours of community service, community based self-help group. Chernin makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends the probationary sentence but argues for less conditional jail time and allow for transfer of any jail time to Milwaukee County and leaves all other conditions to the discretion of the Court. Evans makes statement, remorseful. Court begins the sentence and State and defense counsel have a discrepency with count being plead to. Evans will now be pleading to count #1 as alleged and count #2 will be DRI. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 10 months in FC jail - huber allowed - no objections to the defendant serving the time in Milwaukee County but it is the ultimate decision of the Sheriff(s) - eligible for community service under 973.01(7m) - credit for 1 day only if revoked - report by 8:30 am on Monday, 8/8/16 but check into jail today for DNA sample, AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars, maintain/obtain full time employment/school (5), 200 hours of community service, costs - take bond posted - refund remainder to poster, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal.
Email from atty Chernin - no jury plea will be entered
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 8, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
Per DA office-request to plea hearing as agreement has been reached. Paperwork from defense attorney forthcoming. cmg
Jury trial on July 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ernest Evans in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:47 PM. State - believe the PH is going to be waived and have filed an Information that mirrors the joint complaint in the anticipation of that. Chernin agrees, provides Court with waiver of PH form. Court has form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Chernin has Information that mirrors the joint complaint, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and pleads NG to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond and sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 01:00 pm. Recalled at 3:58  PM. Chernin wants to address bond - asking for a reduction in bond for stated reasons. State - bond - no objections to a reduction in bond to $5000.00 cash. Court reduces bond to $5000.00 with same conditions, refund $2500.00 to poster.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ernest Evans in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:01 AM. Also called companion case 15CF184 (State vs Cynthia Decorah). Ernest Evans appears in person and his attorney Michael Chernin appears telephonically with leave of the Court. Decorah and Burns have complaint. Court reads complaint for Decorah first. Decorah understands charges and penalties. Evans understands charges and penalties. Court instructs counsel on current bond conditions (Decorah - $7500.00 cash that is not posted and Evans - $7500.00 that is posted). Burns asks for reduction in bond for Decorah from $7500.00 to $2000.00 for stated reasons. State - bond - no objections to a reduction in bond but wants some cash yet (at least $2000.00). Court - bond on Decorah - reduces to $2000.00 cash with same conditions, sets for PH. Burns and Chernin waive time limits for PH's. Court continues bond on Evans case. Court will track all citations - no notice sent.
